void commitSelection (  Component *  component  )  [private]

virtual void onContentClick (  Component *  component,
Vector  position,
bool  rangeSelection,
bool  keepSelection
)  [virtual]
 

Called when the component is clicked (usually using the left mouse button), called by the scrolling field with content-transformed coordinates.

A click is raised after the mouse has been pressed and released, and no dragging operation has started.

Parameters:
component The component that received the event.
position The position where the click occurred relative to the upper-left corner of the content.
rangeSelection Whether to keep the current selection start, e.g. on Windows systems, because the SHIFT button was pressed.
keepSelection Whether to keep the existing selection, e.g. on Windows systems, because the CTRL button was pressed.
See also:
onPress()

onRelease()

virtual void onEnter (  Component *  component  )  [virtual]
 

Called when the ENTER key is pressed on the event target, the component has the inner-most focus, and the event not handled otherwise by the component.

Parameters:
component The component that received the event.
